job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Welcoming staff and kind staff who are very passionate about prep
cons: No cons to share about prep

job_title: Systems Administrator in New York, NY
pros: It's a great place to work and learn from each other. Everyone helps out.
cons: Pay is not high but experience is amazing.

job_title: Post-Placement Counselor in New York, NY
cons: no room for growth from what i saw

pros: This job allows for a lot of autonomy and independence as a teacher. The students are bright, motivated and respectful. The pay is good, especially if you do the summer session.
cons: When doing a full load of courses, there is a lot of repetition (teaching same thing over and over, sometimes 4 to 5 times per day, depending on the subject you teach). Curriculum is a bit stale (while there is independence and autonomy for individual teachers, the curriculum in terms of, say, what the students read in Literature is set in stone from the time of the founding of the program), which shows in the kids; they could be more inspired with a fresher curriculum. The administration is run like a well oiled machine at this point; there are no glaring administration problems. I will say that there are flare ups of evidence of some hard alignment with political movements, an alignment that I imagine could feel ostracizing for those who do not organically belong to certain identity groups. These flare ups are not overt and do not even approach the level of action-worthy, but they are there and it is felt, more some times than other times.

job_title: Operations Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Everyone I've met in the office is extremely welcoming, supervisors are not rude and show some sort of inclusivity as a part timer and new recruit. HR is amazing and makes onboarding extremely easy, and is very approachable.
cons: Slow growth, not much turn over rate so positions are not widely available if you want to progress with this company

job_title: Post-Placement Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Great sense of community. Supervisors really foster genuine and supportive relationships with employees. Its is an encouraging environment, and there are many opportunities to innovate and try new things.
cons:
There aren't many cons that i can think of except:
- Vacation time is accumulated with each paycheck instead of just given in chunks. 
- Pay could be better (but it is a non-profit so it's understandable)

job_title: Development Officer in New York, NY
pros: This organization delivers results on its mission. They consistently hit short and long-term benchmarks for success. The alumni community is extraordinary and are accomplishing great things. Colleagues are thoughtful and dedicated. A standard of excellence is taken seriously.
cons: They are working to build a spirit of innovation and learning, where there was room for improvement. Like all nonprofit environments, work-life balance can be hard to achieve.

job_title: Annual Funds Manager in New York, NY
cons: poor management and room for growth

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Most people are personally aligned with the mission of the organization, which is great.  It makes for a truly rewarding experience.  There are also a ton of alums who work here and are clearly already committed to Prep because they have seen first-hand the impact of it on their own lives.
cons: They pay is absolutely terrible, especially for the long hours and investment of personal time and energy required to really do your best here.

job_title: Middle School Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Tons of perks. You'll never have to pay for food...ever. You'll receive a company credit card to take care of students. Flexible hours. Come and go as you please. Very laid back. Perfect job for people still trying to figure out what to do with their lives. Low stress.
cons: You're basically working for free. You'll make just enough money to rent a room in an apartment in Washington Heights with two other people.

job_title: Finance Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
Small staff in finance that handles a lot that goes on.
Constant challenge in dealing with anything money related. Even more challenging during auditing season.
Learn lots in accounting work.
cons: Weird location where it feels like you are working in someones house. It is a brownstone on the west side. But it is still an awesome location.

review_title: Exploitative - do not work here at this time
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great mission, great kids, company credit card for work for professional employees
cons:
You will work really long hours, and sometimes go two full work weeks with no days off, which you will never be compensated for. Pay is not competitive, and you will not be paid for skill, education, or experience. Executive level management does not have the basic skill set necessary to do their jobs, and thus rely very heavily on staff to complete the most basic of tasks. With high employee turnover, this means that nobody remains to train new staff members, and staff in lateral positions are relied upon for training. Staff members often absorb work of parting employees without discussion or compensation. Excellent work performance and competence by staff members is not awarded, but punished. The better you are at your job, the more work you will absorb, and the less you will be paid.

Executive management has little to no idea of what systems and processes are in place to make the organization run, and are not able to do tasks that each member of their departments are able to. Favoritism runs rampant, and you will not be awarded for skill, but for loyalty to executives. If you speak up, you will be reprimanded and silenced. Executive level management have their own interpretation of organizational rules and procedures, and use this to their advantage.

job_title: Post-Placement Counselor in New York, NY
pros: If you love to work with kids, it's great. And if you'd like to work in the private school education network, its a great launching pad.
cons: The pay is HORRIFIC. That's why most counselors only stay for a max of 2 years and then move on to grad school, work in education, or something else

job_title: Post Placement Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Team of counselors are as close as family.  Good training and PD.  Children are good to work with, with a few exceptions.
cons: Management needed improvement, work many weekends.

pros: Prep for Prep's mission is excellent.  The caliber of staff is excellent.
cons: I have no complaints about working at Prep for Prep.

review_title: amazing mission, incredible students, hard working staff
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: inspiring students, effective program, dedicated coworkers
cons: it's a demanding environment for staff and students.

pros: Great organization and it's mission for education
cons: small and not having a supporting of staff
